candidates.title: Add a tunnel app
candidates.body:
It can be used to benchmark.

Usage:
sstunnel -v -s 127.0.0.1:8488 -m plain -k password -b 127.0.0.1:1090 -f 127.0.0.1:5201

"-f xxx" : the target/forwad address xxx

candidates.title: Migrate to std::future, async/await
candidates.body:
- [x] Socks5 Protocol Library
- [x] TCP Relay Tools
- [ ] DNS Resolving (dep: https://github.com/bluejekyll/trust-dns/pull/849)
    - [ ] Build with tokio's 0.2.x
- [x] `ring` upgrades to `v0.16.x`
    - [x] Ring removed support of SHA1 algorithm, uses separated crate `hkdf` and `sha1`
- [x] TCP Relay
- [x] UDP Relay
- [ ] <del>DNS Proxy</del>
- [x] Binaries (`sslocal`, `ssserver`, <del>`ssdns`</del>)
- [x] Tests
- [x] Windows

candidates.title: Remove extern crate statements
candidates.body:
Now when we have upgraded to Rust 2018 edition, the `extern crate` statements are not really needed. For macros they can be imported using the normal module import system.

Also used the little `features = ["derive"]` trick on `serde` in order to not have to depend on both crates explicitly.

candidates.title: Apply cargo fix --edition and upgrade to 2018
candidates.body:
Upgrading to Rust 2018 gives us access to NLL and other new features. As well as the async ecosystem whenever it's stabilized. The earlier one jumps to 2018 the smaller the hurdle likely.

After this it's also possible to get rid of basically all `extern crate` statements. But I did not want to make this PR too complex, so refrained from that here and now.

candidates.title: Prepare crate for library use
candidates.body:
This PR's primary purpose is to decouple the shadowsocks service from the console. Doing so will enable one to use the crate as a library, and start/stop the service independently of the hosting process' lifetime.

The CTRL+C handler is no longer hardwired into the service logic, and no longer invokes a process shutdown when activated, but merely a shutdown of the service.

Additionally, it improves the monitoring of plugin subprocesses and ensures they are cleaned up when the shadowsocks service is stopped.

candidates.title: Feature gate RC4 cipher
candidates.body:
Hi. Would it be OK to feature gate the RC4 cipher? This crypto is considered quite broken, and we are trying to link towards our a stripped down version of OpenSSL without RC4 support. We can't do that while this crate is using RC4 functions however.

I have enabled this feature by default, so merging this PR should not cause any real change to the project as is, but for those who want to get rid of RC4 they can now build with `--no-default-features` if they want to.

candidates.title: Migrate tokio and uses new features
candidates.body:
* #100 Migrated to Tokio Runtime.
* #105 Fixed "Too many open files" in UDP relay.
* Implemented a new ssdns server, which can serve as a DNS server and proxy DNS queries via ShadowSocks' UDP relay.
* Replaced `ToSocketAddrs` with `trust-dns`
* Uses impl Trait for functions
* Updated dependencies

candidates.title: Add experimental SIV support
candidates.body:
This PR will add experimental Aes128PmacSiv, Aes256PmacSiv support.

It has some performance loss, but will be an immune nonce reuse attack.

candidates.title: 棄用 rust-crypto
candidates.body:
[rust-crypto](https://github.com/DaGenix/rust-crypto) 經已有一段時間無任何維護，並且缺少公開審查。
這個 PR 使用 [ring](https://github.com/briansmith/ring) 同 [sodiumoxide](https://github.com/dnaq/sodiumoxide) 以及 [md-5](https://github.com/RustCrypto/hashes/tree/master/md5) 代替 rust-crypto，以期獲得更好的性能與安全性。

同時我添加了一些額外的算法支持，如 `ChaCha20Poly1305`、`XSalsa20`、`Aes128Ctr`。
並且移除了不支持的 `Aes192Gcm`。

另外在有些情況下，可能會不想要依賴 libsodium，因此我將 sodiumoxide 設爲可選。

chosen_pr.title: Apply cargo fix --edition and upgrade to 2018
chosen_pr.body:
Upgrading to Rust 2018 gives us access to NLL and other new features. As well as the async ecosystem whenever it's stabilized. The earlier one jumps to 2018 the smaller the hurdle likely.

After this it's also possible to get rid of basically all `extern crate` statements. But I did not want to make this PR too complex, so refrained from that here and now.
